definitions.definition: in or to what place or situation

examples.text: I wonder where they will take us to.
Where *(= at what point)* did I go wrong in my calculations?
Where *(= in what book, newspaper, etc.)* did you read that?
Just where *(= to what situation or final argument)* is all this leading us?

definitions.definition: used after words or phrases that refer to a place or situation to mean ‘at, in or to which’

examples.text: It's one of the few countries where people drive on the left.

definitions.definition: the place or situation in which

examples.text: We then moved to Paris, where we lived for six years.

wordOrigin: Old English hwǣr, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch waar and German wo.
